page.title: 04THE NORTH LODGE
page.content: The North Lodge stands at the Northern entrance to{Hurn Court}on the ite of the original single storey gate house. The new house is made of red brick which has some blue and yellow in it. The house has two bay windows, one at the front and one at the side of the house. It has red drainpipes and all he woodwork is a creamy yellow. This is because Lady Malmesbury wanted this house to be different to all the rest because this is the house where she stayed. The other cottages are cream and green . The house has nine rooms three of which are bedrooms, and there is a modern kitchen. The fireplace in the lounge is a new one but it has been made to look old.
